channel.title: (Audio Spectrums) Adobe After Effects issues
channel.description: So, I'm trying to create an audio spectrum (which I already know how to do) for one of my old remixes. But every time I end up finished with whatever the project is, the end result of the video becomes extremely choppy and laggy. even though the framerate was set to 30 fps. Do I need a more powerful computer or something? if anyone has any experience with Adobe AE, it would be great if you could provide assistance.

item.title: (Audio Spectrums) Adobe After Effects issues
item.dc:creator: NIAZU
item.description:
Thank you for the assistance

Read full topic

item.title: (Audio Spectrums) Adobe After Effects issues
item.dc:creator: Autrix
item.description:
When i get a new computer NEXT WEEK It will have adobe after affects and THE REPLAY BUTTON Will depict audio spectums. and you need to render your file through adobe media encoder at HD 1820p then its a file that us quality

Read full topic

item.title: (Audio Spectrums) Adobe After Effects issues
item.dc:creator: anon41616463
item.description:
Also, having experience of using AE, you might want to render it in Media Encoder, as you have more control over encoding and compression options. Plus there’s nice presets for different devices to view on like desktop, iPhone, iPad, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: (Audio Spectrums) Adobe After Effects issues
item.dc:creator: CammeoCam
item.description:
Yup, after the rendering is done it will go back to 30fps but in the destination and output (.avi preferably) in that file you set it to. Hope this helped!

Read full topic

But every time I end up finished with whatever the project is, the end result of the video becomes extremely choppy and laggy. even though the framerate was set to 30 fps.
